required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Transfers of Fresh and Thawed Embryos in Patients With Prior Failed Embryo Transfer Cycles
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Transfers of Fresh and Thawed Embryos in Patients With Prior Failed Embryo Transfer Cycles

brief_summary.textblock: This study seeks to determine if patients with a history of failed fresh embryo transfer(s) will have increased success rates with embryo cryopreservation and subsequent thawed embryo transfer when compared to fresh embryo transfer.

detailed_description.textblock: Implantation failure remains a significant problem in cycles of in vitro fertilization (IVF). Patients with a history of implantation failure in fresh autologous cycles have been shown have reduced chance of success in subsequent fresh autologous cycles. A potentially frequent cause of implantation failure is reduced endometrial receptivity following ovarian stimulation, perhaps due to the effects of supraphysiologic hormone levels on endometrial development. Therefore, such patients may have a greater chance of success if all of their embryos are cryopreserved for use in a subsequent cycle in which endometrial development can be more carefully controlled, absent the effects of ovarian stimulation. Therefore this study compares success rates in cycles of fresh embryo transfer and cycles with transfer of frozen-thawed embryos.

primary_outcome.measure: Ongoing pregnancy with fetal heart motion

arm_group.description: Patients in the control group will undergo conventional IVF cycles with fresh blastocyst transfer.
Patients in the Test group will have their embryos cryopreserved for transfer in a second cycle.

intervention.description: Subjects in the Test group will have their embryos cryopreserved for transfer in a subsequent cycle.
Subjects in the Control group will receive fresh embryo transfer.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18 to 40 years
- Cycle day 3 FSH less than 10 IU/l
- At least 8 antral follicles
- At least one previous autologous embryo transfer cycle that did not result in ongoing pregnancy at 10 weeks.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Embryo biopsy
- Any prior fresh embryo transfer that resulted in live birth

reference.citation: Shapiro BS, Daneshmand ST, Garner FC, Aguirre M, Thomas S. Large blastocyst diameter, early blastulation, and low preovulatory serum progesterone are dominant predictors of clinical pregnancy in fresh autologous cycles. Fertil Steril. 2008 Aug;90(2):302-9. Epub 2007 Oct 1.

Shapiro BS, Daneshmand ST, Garner FC, Aguirre M, Ross R. Contrasting patterns in in vitro fertilization pregnancy rates among fresh autologous, fresh oocyte donor, and cryopreserved cycles with the use of day 5 or day 6 blastocysts may reflect differences in embryo-endometrium synchrony. Fertil Steril. 2008 Jan;89(1):20-6. Epub 2007 Jan 16.
